column5: I'm thinking of hitting one of my go-to rivers in the area. I usually hit it for bass, bullheads and panfish in the late spring and summer. Do you think with these recently warm temps that the bluegills, crappie,  perch or bullheads might be cruising the river shallows? Or with the late spring, am I being overly optimistic? Any thoughts?  Cheers
If the time permits; then why not try it?
Anytime is a good time for fishing
Definitely a firm shot at bullheads right now.
